nodes.bodyText: What about make PMMLRuntimeBuilder accept a Stream as parameter so that you can avoid to iterate over the list twice?
Can you please add the number of models found in the message? I would suggest to update the message too because you can find 0 models so probably Wrong number of models... is more accurate
Is this a constant? If so can you please move it to a static field?

@danielezonca
It is not a constant. It is a left-over from legacy implementation and I still have to find a clean way to use/generate it.

In a future ticket I would consider to move these methods to PMMLRuntimeBuilder and make PMMLAssembler use them instead of the opposite so that we will have this PMMLRuntimeBuilder as single entry point for both. Wdyt?

This would make sense only if/when there would a PMML module implemented outside any "container" - so that common code (e.g. PMMLRuntimeBuilder) could be referred to by both containers (Drools/Kogito) without having one of them depending on the other.
To be removed?
Is it a constant? If so can you please move it to a static field?
To be removed fixed/removed before merging (or at least create a ticket to track this)
Do a tag release to move to a fixed version before merging (or wait 7.41.0.Final if it makes sense)

nodes.bodyText: STRONGLY_TYPED_CONFIGURATION_KEY is a DMN specific configuration to enable bean generation and replace Map<String, Object> as input. Does PMML have something similar? I think it can be removed
I think we can remove strongly typed here (as comment above)
To be removed?
Side note for another ticket: I think it could be nice to move this class to a -api module instead of -commons. Wdyt?

nodes.bodyText: I think this should be removed. It is a feature specific of DMN
Not used (and btw after a recent refactor now we use AddonsConfig class to wrap all these boolean)
To be removed, addonsConfig fields already contains all of them
Can you please add model path to error message (it should be available in resource)
Model name is automatically generated (when missing) now.
Can you please add model path to error message (it should be available in resource)
Side note: it would be nice in a future ticket to refactor this code to invoke directly rule generators (/cc @evacchi @mariofusco )
This is needed in DMN to properly serialize dates and duration. I don't think PMML supports these data types. Am I wrong?
Can you add predictive to the message?
Why are you returning null instead of throwing an exception like you do in loadModel method?
Isn't modelPath also available inside Path?
To be removed, addonsConfig already contains this information
Internal PMML tracing is not supported yet so this code should be removed
To be removed

As far as I can see this and the implementation of this method are the only real change in the whole file.
Can you please revert the formatting? I think should increase the limit of characters per line

Is there any reason to add kie-pmml-commons to kogito API? I have some concerns to add this to kogito-api bacause this should be only a public API which does not change often. With this we are exposing also kie-pmml-commons as public API. I would suggest to refactor this somehow in the way that api itself does not depend on kie-pmml-commons.

nodes.bodyText: Same as above
What is the reason of this change?

If you look the original code - and the invoked method - they both expected a file to be a "jar" file, which is not verified anywhere. An artifact may contain a "pom" file, and in such situation the snippet:
private static KieModuleModel getDependencyKieModel(final File jar) throws IOException {
         ZipFile zipFile = new ZipFile(jar)
throws an Excpetion.
Similar modification has been proposed inside Drools too.

@gitgabrio @danielezonca I have stumbled upon this when trying to upgrade kogito to the latest snapshot in optaplanner.
Does it mean that if I declare a dependency on org.kie.kogito:drools-core, which depends on drools-core-static, I have to declare also a runtime dependency on org.kie:kie-pmml-evaluator-core (or rather org.kie.kogito:kogito-pmml)?

@rsynek
See https://issues.redhat.com/browse/KOGITO-3290
